title: CBT-Based Educational Game Design for Substance Abuse Prevention

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of societal impacts and prevention policies related to substance abuse
context.additional_context: A hybrid education model conducted in a smartphone-centric limited technology environment, combining face-to-face sessions with mobile game-based learning activities

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the personal and societal risks of drug abuse from the perspective of cognitive distortions.
Learners can apply problem-solving strategies using CBT techniques to real-world cases and propose drug abuse prevention measures.
Learners can improve decision-making accuracy in drug-temptation scenarios to over 80% through educational game simulations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
